page.title: 13ROWNEY WOOD part 1
page.content: {Rowney Wood}covers an area of approximately{85 hectares.}It is probably ancient semi-natural wood- land and is now mainly composed of {oak, Norway Spruce}and{Western Red {Cedar}and a few other decidous trees. Fallow and muntjac{deer}live in the wood and various small mammals and birds. There is a wealth of plants including several species of{orchids. The wood is managed by the {Forestry Commission}and the public have access at all times. A local farmer owns the shooting rights. Some areas of Rowney Wood are exclusively Western Red Cedar whilst others are mainly oak or a mixture of Norway Spruce and oak. The Forestry Commission planted three rows of Norway Spruce and two rows of oak about 30 years ago...(cont pg 14)..
